heading: always loyal
subheading: the income at issue in the hubbell indictments came to him after he left government but before he served a previous prison term for defrauding the little rock law firm where he and hillary clinton toiled. white house officials have admitted steering the lucrative work his way. they say it was to help an old friend; prosecutors think it was "hush money" to keep him quiet about clinton misdeeds. according to transcripts obtained by the ap, hubbell, while in prison, said to presidential aide marsha scott, "there are issues that i have to stay away from to protect others, and i will. have i ever been disloyal?" "oh, god, no," scott responded.
author: wired staff
